城市数据开放沙龙

Aug 26, 2014

#120 Red Light Camera Tickets

A Chicago Tribune investigation recently found that the City’s red light camera program may have been ticketing thousands of drivers unfairly during suspicious spikes.

Alex Bordens and Alex Richards will discuss how the Tribune analyzed more than 4 million tickets and created an interactive database to help readers find out if they were ticketed during a spike.

Breakout groups

As usual, we will have topic specific working groups to help guide conversations and potential apps:

  • Orientation/Civic Hacking 101: Christopher Whitaker
  • Code Clinic: René M. Paccha, Demond Drummer, Karl Fogel
  • Working with Data 101: Matt Gee, James Salvatore
  • Transportation: Steven Vance
  • Education: Josh Kalov, Forest Gregg
  • Environment: Scott Beslow
  • Social Service Delivery: Rose Afriyie
  • Modelling Pension Reform in Illinois: Denis Roarty, Ben Galewsky

6pm
Aug 26, 2014

Braintree office
222 W Merchandise Mart Plz 8th Floor
Chicago, IL

Food provided by Code for America
